#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

// Function to compute first program's result
long compute_first(int n, int arr[]) {
    long cnt[21] = {0};
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        int num = arr[i] + 10; // adjust to 0-20
        cnt[num]++;
    }
    long res = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        res += cnt[i] * cnt[20 - i];
    }
    res += (cnt[10] * (cnt[10] - 1)) / 2;
    return res;
}

// Function to compute second program's result
char* compute_second(const char* directions) {
    int x = 0, y = 0;
    int co[2][101]; // assuming max steps is 100 (since directions length can be up to 100)
    int k = 0;
    co[0][k] = x;
    co[1][k] = y;
    k++;
    int len = strlen(directions);
    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        char c = directions[i];
        switch(c) {
            case 'L': x--; break;
            case 'R': x++; break;
            case 'U': y++; break;
            case 'D': y--; break;
        }
        co[0][k] = x;
        co[1][k] = y;
        k++;
    }
    int flag = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < k - 3; i++) {
        for (int j = i + 3; j < k; j++) {
            int dx = co[0][i] - co[0][j];
            if (dx < 0) dx = -dx;
            int dy = co[1][i] - co[1][j];
            if (dy < 0) dy = -dy;
            if ((dx <= 1 && dy == 0) || (dy <= 1 && dx == 0)) {
                flag = 0;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (!flag) break;
    }
    return flag ? "OK" : "BUG";
}

// Function to compute third program's result
void compute_third(const char* input_str) {
    int s = 0; // boolean flag, 0 is false, 1 is true
    for (int i = 0; input_str[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        char c = input_str[i];
        if (c == '.') {
            if (s) {
                printf("1");
                s = 0;
            } else {
                printf("0");
            }
        } else {
            if (s) {
                printf("2");
                s = 0;
            } else {
                s = 1;
            }
        }
    }
}

int main() {
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    int arr[n];
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &arr[i]);
    }
    // Compute first's result
    long res = compute_first(n, arr);
    // Convert res to string for second's input
    char second_input[20];
    sprintf(second_input, "%ld", res);
    // Compute second's result
    char* second_output = compute_second(second_input);
    // Compute third's result using second's output
    compute_third(second_output);
    return 0;
}
